intro: Strychnos dantaensis, commonly known as the African star apple or yellow star apple, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
